title: Facebook: Still Irrational, Still Too Cheap
text: Facebook continues to generate strong free cash flows, which the market will be sure to reward over time.

title: Facebook Is Too Big for Its Own Good, Shareholder Natasha Lamb Says
text: Arjuna Capital Managing Partner Natasha Lamb discusses Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg's internet regulation plan and the recent controversies surrounding the social-media giant with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology.

title: Look How Addicted People Are to Facebook
text: Most people won't give up Facebook for less than $42 per month.

title: Buy Facebook (FB) Stock on Instagram 'Checkout' E-Commerce Innovation?
text: Shares of Facebook (FB) popped over 3.3% Tuesday in continuation of their impressive 2019 climb on the back of news that the social media company has improved its e-commerce capabilities on Instagram.

title: Zuckerberg should learn from the 1982 Tylenol poisoning scandal, says early Facebook investor
text: Facebook's executives are still experiencing a crisis of public trust. Here's how they could have managed it, suggests Roger McNamee.

title: Mark Zuckerberg hints at dedicated news section on Facebook
text: Mark Zuckerberg discusses the possibility of paying publishers for news content.

title: Facebook Needs to Be an Arbiter of Truth
text: The social networking giant might not want to, but it has to.

title: Facebook deletes hundreds of fake accounts ahead of Indian elections
text: Alex Stamos, former Facebook chief security officer, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss how Facebook and other social media platforms could fight disinformation on their platforms and weighs in on what regulation could be done.

title: Final trades: KKR, Cisco Systems, Facebook, & Vulcan Materials
text: The "Halftime Report" traders give their top stocks to watch for the second half.

title: McNamee on Mark Zuckerberg's calls for regulation
text: Roger McNamee, author of "Zucked" and early Facebook investor, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Mark Zuckerberg's calls for regulation.

title: How Instagram And Facebook Makes Money
text: Everyday more than 2 billion people use Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp or Messenger. That's more than a quarter of the world's population.

title: Mark Zuckerberg asked Congress to regulate content. Rep. McMorris Rodgers has freedom of speech concer
text: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg published an op-ed in the Washington Post calling for internet regulations in four key areas: harmful content, election integrity, privacy and data portability.

title: Facebook May Get a News Tab Soon: Should Apple Worry?
text: Facebook set to take another step ahead toward battling fake news menace, now planning to launch a dedicated news tab in collaboration with publishers.

title: Instagram's new e-commerce feature is a $10 billion opportunity for Facebook, Deutsche Bank says
text: Facebook added a feature to make its Instagram platform a more efficient place for social media users to shop and buy, which Deutsche Bank believes "can drive monetization" further for the app.
